member.summary: The server failed to execute the request due to a resource not behaving according to the contract.
member.example: We call an external service, expecting it to either be successful, or to return a FulcrumError. If it doesn't, this kind of exception is thrown.

member.name: T:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.FulcrumError
member.summary: Information that will be returned when a REST service returns a non successful HTTP status code
member.remarks: Inspired by the follwing articles http://blog.restcase.com/rest-api-error-codes-101/ https://stormpath.com/blog/spring-mvc-rest-exception-handling-best-practices-part-1

member.name: T:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.IFulcrumError
member.summary: An interface for error information. Typically used by .

member.name: P:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.IFulcrumError.TechnicalMessage
member.summary: Mandatory technical information that a developer might find useful. This is where you might include exception messages, stack traces, or anything else that you think will help a developer.
member.remarks: This message is not expected to contain any of the codes or identifiers that are already contained in this error type, sucha as the error or the .

member.name: P:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.IFulcrumError.FriendlyMessage
member.summary: An optional human readable error message that can potentially be shown directly to an application end user (not a developer). It should be friendly and easy to understand and convey a concise reason as to why the error occurred. It should probaby not contain technical information.

member.name: P:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.IFulcrumError.Type
member.summary: Errors are grouped into different types, such as "BusinessRule", "NotFound", "Unavailable". Type is a mandatory unique id for the type of error. The recommendation is to use a readable string such as "Xlent.Fulcrum.AssertionFailed"

member.name: P:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.IFulcrumError.MoreInfoUrl
member.summary: An optional URL that anyone seeing the error message can click (or copy and paste) in a browser. The target web page should describe the error condition fully, as well as potential solutions to help them resolve the error condition.

member.name: P:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.IFulcrumError.IsRetryMeaningful
member.summary: Mandatory indication for if it would be meaningful to try sending the request again.

member.name: P:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.IFulcrumError.RecommendedWaitTimeInSeconds
member.summary: If is true, then this optional property can give a recommended interval to wait before the request is sent again. A value less or equal to 0.0 means that no recommendation was given.

member.name: P:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.IFulcrumError.ServerTechnicalName
member.summary: An optional technical name for the server that created this error information.
member.remarks: Useful when for a call that is "deep", i.e. the call was relayed to another server.

member.name: P:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.IFulcrumError.InstanceId
member.summary: A mandatory unique identifier for this particular instance of the error. Ideally, the same identifier should not be used ever again. The recommendation is to use a newly created GUID.

member.name: P:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.IFulcrumError.ErrorLocation
member.summary: An optional hint on where this error occurred in the code. The recommendation is to use the name of the DLL file combined with a fixed GUID for the specific location within the DLL.

member.name: P:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.IFulcrumError.Code
member.summary: An optional error code for the error. A way to use a standard , but still be more specific. Will typically be a part of the .

member.name: P:Xlent.Lever.Libraries2.Core.Error.Model.IFulcrumError.CorrelationId
member.summary: All calls that were involved in the chain that led to this error (successful calls or not) will all be marked in the logs with this mandatory CorrelationId. It is valuable if someone wants to track down exactly what happened.

member.summary: Copies all fields from .
